head.title: 2 European Exchanges Eager to Join Nasdaq

identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Banking, Finance and Insurance

hedline.hl1: 2 European Exchanges Eager to Join Nasdaq

abstract.p: London Stock Exchange and Frankfurt exchange, or Deutsche Borse, say real goal of merger is to explore complete partnership with Nasdaq, which is run by National Association of Securities Dealers (M)

block.p: Not content with orchestrating a merger with the London Stock Exchange, the chairman of the Frankfurt stock exchange said today that he wanted to explore a full merger with the Nasdaq market in the United States.

In a statement about their own plans to merge, the London Stock Exchange and the Frankfurt exchange, or the Deutsche Borse, said their real goal was to explore a complete partnership with Nasdaq, which is run by the National Association of Securities Dealers.

Not content with orchestrating a merger with the London Stock Exchange, the chairman of the Frankfurt stock exchange said today that he wanted to explore a full merger with the Nasdaq market in the United States.

In a statement about their own plans to merge, the London Stock Exchange and the Frankfurt exchange, or the Deutsche Borse, said their real goal was to explore a complete partnership with Nasdaq, which is run by the National Association of Securities Dealers.

The two exchanges reiterated earlier statements that they wanted to set up cross-shareholdings with Nasdaq as part of an effort to set up a global trading system. But the statement today went further.
A spokeswoman for Nasdaq said it was in discussions with the Frankfurt and London exchanges about their relationship but it was ''premature to discuss anything in further detail.''

Werner Seifert, chief executive of Deutsche Borse in Frankfurt and the man who is slated to run the combined London-Frankfurt operation, said today that global connections were increasingly critical to success.
''As a final objective, a European goal is not far reaching enough and that's why we are talking with Nasdaq,'' Mr. Seifert said at a news conference here.
Officials at Deutsche Borse said they had viewed a full merger with Nasdaq as an appealing possibility for months.

But industry executives predict it will be a long while before Mr. Seifert pulls off such a trans-Atlantic merger. For one thing, there is still resistance in London and Frankfurt to the proposed merger of the two European exchanges, which is to be called iX.
Frankfurt brokers are already worried that Nasdaq's European operations, linked to iX, will be based in London and will take business from Frankfurt.
